title: KG-Infused RAG: Augmenting Corpus-Based RAG with External Knowledge Graphs
main_contribution: Introduces KG-Infused RAG, a framework that integrates knowledge graphs into RAG systems using spreading activation - a cognitive process for concept association and inference. Addresses the limitation of existing RAG methods that rely on single sources (either unstructured text or structured knowledge).
methodology:
- Implements spreading activation mechanism for knowledge graph traversal
- Retrieves KG facts and expands queries accordingly
- Combines corpus passages with structured facts for multi-source retrieval
- Uses preference learning on key pipeline stages for optimization
- Functions as plug-and-play enhancement module for existing RAG systems
key_findings:
- Consistently outperforms vanilla RAG by 3.8% to 13.8% across five QA benchmarks
- Demonstrates effectiveness when integrated with Self-RAG, showing versatility
- Enables interpretable, multi-source retrieval grounded in semantic structure
- Provides cognitively-inspired knowledge activation mechanisms
technical_innovation: First framework to integrate knowledge graphs with corpus-based RAG using spreading activation, enabling semantic reasoning and concept association during retrieval
practical_impact: Offers significant performance improvements while maintaining compatibility with existing RAG architectures, making it easily adoptable for real-world applications
limitations: Requires access to domain-relevant knowledge graphs and may need additional computational resources for graph traversal operations
future_directions: Potential for exploring different KG structures, scaling to larger graphs, and application to multi-modal RAG scenarios
